description: An unusual Iron Age and Roman settlement. Around the later 4th CE a large enclosure was built, associated with a hall. This has been argued to be a sanctuary, or shrine.
bibliography: Cunliffe, and Poole. “Thruxton, Hants, 2002.” In The Danebury Environs Roman Programme: A Wessex Landscape During the Roman Era, Vol. 2, 2008.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Thruxton (Hampshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
